JavaCSVReader

Class Vector2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaCSVReader.Vector2D

  • public class Vector2D
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a 2D vector.

    The Vector2D class behaves as a normal vector would (as the data is contained by vectors), however it's table properties behave in a unique manner.
    The most important property of this class is that the table is ALWAYS rectangular. That is no column has a size greater than the other columns and the same with the rows.
    Secondly items are not "removed". When an item is called to be removed it is instead replaced by a null object. This is done to uphold the first property.
    Thirdly, as an effect of the first property appending items to a column will automatically append null objects at the end of all other columns (and a similiar affect for appending to a row).
    However, do note: the Vector2D class AUTOMAGICALLY resizes when rows/columns/ items are removed.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    theNerd247 (Noah Harvey)

    • Method Detail

      • appendColumn

        public void appendColumn(java.util.Vector newColumn)
        Adds a new column of objects to the 2D vector

        The new height of the table after adding the given column is determined by choosing the greatest value between newColumn.size() and height

        Parameters:
        newColumn - the to add to the end of all the other columns

      • appendRow

        public void appendRow(java.util.Vector newRow)
        Adds a new row of objects to the 2D vector

        The new row of the table after adding the given column is determined by choosing the greatest value between newRow.size() and width

        Parameters:
        newRow - the vector of objects to append to the 2D vector

      • removeItemAt

        public void removeItemAt(int x,
                int y)

        NOTE: this method does NOT resize the column the item was contained. Instead the item is simply replaced with a new object

        y - the row index

      • autosize

        public void autosize(int x,
            int y)
        Autogrow the table to a given size


        NOTE This will remove any items that are at index x,y or greater

        Parameters:
        x - the width of the table
        y - the height of the table
